result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Jerome Stanfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to count  2. Time served disposition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Jerome Stanfield

records.addlTxt: count two
Count four

Defendant Eric Jerome Stanfield appeared by video.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor appeared by video for Eric Jerome Stanfield.  Attorney Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant ordered to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 4. 

AS TO COUNT 4: Defendant ordered to serve 8 days in the House of Correction, with 8 days time served, consecutive to count 2.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

- Report for probation by 5pm on 10/25/2022
- Serve 30 days condition time, STAYED at the discretion of the agent
- Complete an anger management class.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.  
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- No contact with victim.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Pay the Domestic Abuse Assessment fee.
- Court set restitution at $0. 

- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Defendant advised of appeal rights.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Eric Jerome Stanfield appeared by video.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor appeared by video for Eric Jerome Stanfield.  Attorney Elaine Fehrs on behalf of Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Sentencing Hearing.  ADA Seelow is in another court and unable to proceed with sentencing.  Parties request adjourned Sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Victim Impact statement
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Counts 2, 4: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

As to Counts 1, 3: Pursuant to negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charges dismissed, but read-in for sentencing purposes.

Court orders current terms and conditions of bail to continue pending sentencing hearing. Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing by Zoom.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Eric Jerome Stanfield in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
